result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas Carl Beaton was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Thomas Carl Beaton was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:30 AM DA calls cases 15CM104, 16CT39, 17CF31, 17CF86, 17CF90, 17CF104, 17CM24, 17CM111 & 18CF61 and 17TR818. Defendant Thomas Carl Beaton appeared with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement on all cases. DA states 18CF61 is still pending, not settled yet. Atty Kirkpatrick asks court to schedule status for later date. So Ordered. DA calls 17TR818 is County of Price case.  Judge addresses all parties.  Atty Kirkpatrick agrees to follow with cases listed on matrix. So ordered. Court advises DE on maximum penalties on all cases.  DE enters plea of GUILTY to 15CM104 Ct.1 & Ct.4  16CT39, 17CF31, 17CF86 Ct. 2, 17CF90, 17CF104 Ct. 2 and on 17CM24 Ct. 1  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct.1.  DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance. Court questions DE on education and work.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty cases below and orders entry of JOC. Comments by all parties on sentencing and recommendations.  on 17TR818 DE enter plea of Guilty. 

Court dismisses Counts on 17CF86 - Ct. 1,3,4,5,6, 15CM104 - Ct. 2 & 3, 17CF104 - Ct. 1, 17CM11 - Ct. 1 & 2, 17CF90 - Ct. 1,2,5,6 17CF31 - Ct. 2 & 3, 17CM24 - Ct. 2, 3 & 4 
Court orders all dismissed counts to be read in for sentencing purposes. 

Court imposes:

Sentence withheld 4 years probation
Conditions of probation

75 Days jail with Huber, Jail term is Consecutive to each other any other sentence and being. Jail sentence to commence within 30 days of 01/31/2019 - DE is given 5 days jail credit 
$250 DNAAS

Ct. 1 -
Sentence withheld 2 years probation 
Conditions of probation
Fine $2,439.50 which includes DNAAS & IID
175 Days in jail with Huber and Jail sentence to commence  within 30 days of 01/31/2019 - DE is given 12 days jail credit. cs 
28 Month DL revocation
28 Month IID
AODA
$65.50 Blood draw cost included in fine

statements
to sever counts

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE not operate a motor vehicle unless he/she has a valid dl in their possession.  DE must maintain absolute sobriety while operating a motor vehicle.

Defendant Thomas Carl Beaton appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
